results.content: Solid beginner course on the steps needed from start to finish for building very basic chrome extensions.  Would love to have seen more material on using external APIs like weather data for example or sports scores...something easy to pull in.  Other than that, great course for beginners!
results.content_html: Solid beginner course on the steps needed from start to finish for building very basic chrome extensions. Would love to have seen more material on using external APIs like weather data for example or sports scores...something easy to pull in. Other than that, great course for beginners!

results.content: Just enough information to get you started on your way to making your own google extension.
results.content_html: Just enough information to get you started on your way to making your own google extension.

results.content: Simple but complete starting point if you are a total novice.  You will feel more confident after you have taken this course, knowing that you can build something small and iterate on it and make it better.
results.content_html: Simple but complete starting point if you are a total novice. You will feel more confident after you have taken this course, knowing that you can build something small and iterate on it and make it better.

results.content:
Very superficial, no dive in, just the simplest extension concept. No concept of frontend and backend, no communication between them ....
The speaker is sometimes hard to understand, but this is my personal meaning and has no impact on this review.

response.content: Hi Stephan. Thank you leaving the feedback. I read all feedback that is left, whether it is good or bad. I appreciate that you felt that the course could have gone into more detail and just covered the simplest extension concepts. This course was always going to be for beginners to give students the knowledge they need to get up and running when building a basic extension. However, adding more detailed concepts in the form of additional lectures is definitely something I will consider for this course. Regarding being hard to understand, I apologise for not being clearer. I put this down as a combination of my accent and it being my first course that I have published! Thank you again though for the review which I have taken on board.
response.content_html: Hi Stephan. Thank you leaving the feedback. I read all feedback that is left, whether it is good or bad. I appreciate that you felt that the course could have gone into more detail and just covered the simplest extension concepts. This course was always going to be for beginners to give students the knowledge they need to get up and running when building a basic extension. However, adding more detailed concepts in the form of additional lectures is definitely something I will consider for this course. Regarding being hard to understand, I apologise for not being clearer. I put this down as a combination of my accent and it being my first course that I have published! Thank you again though for the review which I have taken on board.

results.content:
For an hour course It's a good introduction, the instructor explains the different types of extension with examples and doesn't waste a lot of time on it. But I would like a more advanced course, maybe a 2h course, going in details about the most used Chrome API.

The created app is silly and it doesn't use any Chrome API. Probably the Getting Started tutorial from Google will do the same job when related to 'how to create your chrome extension'.
results.content_html:
For an hour course It's a good introduction, the instructor explains the different types of extension with examples and doesn't waste a lot of time on it. But I would like a more advanced course, maybe a 2h course, going in details about the most used Chrome API.

The created app is silly and it doesn't use any Chrome API. Probably the Getting Started tutorial from Google will do the same job when related to 'how to create your chrome extension'.

results.content: No fluff! Did a great job explaning the basic of a Chrome extension. I like the example of different types of Chrome extensions he shares and explain. Also, you get to build a chrome extension too. I feel I can create more simple chrome extension after watching these videos in an hour. Of course my journey just beginning... he give you many resources to keep learning. In my review I give the course 5 stars for newbie.

response.content: Thank you so much for taking the time to review the course, Karl. It really is greatly appreciated and I'm really pleased you enjoyed the course!

results.content: It was okay and although simple since this IS supposed to be a beginner course it would have been nice to get an understanding of Chrome extensions scripts and their scopes.
